intro: Galium obliquum var. centroniae, commonly known as the Sierra bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
